Why were ND3 molecules used instead of NH3 for neutron powder diffraction experiments?
answer: Hydrogen has a large incoherent neutron scattering cross section, which results in high background noise. Deuterium has a much smaller incoherent scattering cross section and a larger coherent scattering cross section, which is better for structural studies.

question: Why is MFM-300(V IV) unstable to ammonia under humid conditions as shown in Figure S6?
